info.name: FlowBuild
info.description:
Default API routes to access FlowBuild engine.

The routes are updated to the workflow-api version available on

[https://github.com/flow-build/workflow-api](https://github.com/flow-build/workflow-api) on this [commit](https://github.com/flow-build/workflow-api/commit/890e32d85625b49b95255d222b9ddf581e6b5855)

item.name: Workflows

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to get a list of the latest version of each workflow the user is allowed to start.

If no workflow is registered or the user is not allowed to access any workflow, it will return an empty list.
This endpoint allows you to get the workflow information by its id.

This endpoint allows you to create ou update a workflow.

#### Body Request

The body must be a valid JSON with 3 key atributes:
+ name: it determines if it will create a new worklfow or update an existing one. The name is case-sensitive and we recommend not o use symbols ou spaces.
+ description: a friendly description for the workflow.
+ blueprint_spec: a JSON object with instructions for execution.

##### Blueprint Spec

| field | type | description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| lanes | arrayOf(Objects) |  |
| nodes | arrayOf(Objects) |  |
| prepare | arrayOf(string) |  |
| environment | Object |  |
| requirements | arrayOf(string) |  |

This endpoint creates a process from a workflow.

The process can only be created if the user is allowed to access the startNode.

After creation the process will be at *unstarted* status.

The startNode input schema is not evaluated during process creation.

This endpoint works about the same way as the create process by id.

It takes the latest version of the workflow with the name provided.

This endpoint creates and run a process from the workflow name. It takes the latest blueprint version registered.

This endpoints works exactly as the _CREATE PROCESS_ and _RUN PROCESS_. The start node input schema evaluation is done after the process creation.

The started process will remain with two different start node states (*unstarted* and  *running*).

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<bpmn:definitions xmlns:bpmn="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/MODEL"
	xmlns:bpmndi="http://www.omg.org/spec/BPMN/20100524/DI" xmlns:dc="http://www.omg.org/spec/DD/20100524/DC"
	xmlns:di="http://www.omg.org/spec/DD/20100524/DI">
	<bpmn:process id="Global_Process" isExecutable="true">
		<bpmn:laneSet id="Global_LaneSet">
			<bpmn:lane id="Lane_1" name="the_only_lane">
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_1</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_2</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_3</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_4</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_5</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_6</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_7</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
				<bpmn:flowNodeRef>Node_8</bpmn:flowNodeRef>
			</bpmn:lane>
		</bpmn:laneSet>
		<bpmn:startEvent id="Node_1" name="1
Start node">
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_1_2</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:startEvent>
		<bpmn:userTask id="Node_2" name="2
User Task">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_1_2</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_7_2</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_2_3</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:userTask>
		<bpmn:serviceTask id="Node_3" name="3
Set To Bag Task">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_2_3</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_3_4</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:serviceTask>
		<bpmn:scriptTask id="Node_4" name="4
Scripted Task">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_3_4</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_4_5</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:scriptTask>
		<bpmn:serviceTask id="Node_5" name="5
Set To Bag Task">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_4_5</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_5_6</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:serviceTask>
		<bpmn:serviceTask id="Node_6" name="6
Set To Bag Task">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_5_6</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_6_7</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:serviceTask>
		<bpmn:exclusiveGateway id="Node_7" name="7
Flow node">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_6_7</bpmn:incoming>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_7_8</bpmn:outgoing>
			<bpmn:outgoing>Flow_7_2</bpmn:outgoing>
		</bpmn:exclusiveGateway>
		<bpmn:endEvent id="Node_8" name="8
Finish node">
			<bpmn:incoming>Flow_7_8</bpmn:incoming>
		</bpmn:endEvent>
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_1_2" sourceRef="Node_1" targetRef="Node_2" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_2_3" sourceRef="Node_2" targetRef="Node_3" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_3_4" sourceRef="Node_3" targetRef="Node_4" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_4_5" sourceRef="Node_4" targetRef="Node_5" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_5_6" sourceRef="Node_5" targetRef="Node_6" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_6_7" sourceRef="Node_6" targetRef="Node_7" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_7_8" sourceRef="Node_7" targetRef="Node_8" />
		<bpmn:sequenceFlow id="Flow_7_2" sourceRef="Node_7" targetRef="Node_2" />
	</bpmn:process>
	<bpmn:collaboration id="Global_Colab">
		<bpmn:participant id="Global_Actor" name="test_workflow" processRef="Global_Process" />
	</bpmn:collaboration>
	<bpmndi:BPMNDiagram id="Global_Diagram">
		<bpmndi:BPMNPlane id="Global_Plane" bpmnElement="Global_Colab">
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_1_di" bpmnElement="Node_1">
				<dc:Bounds x="114" y="72" width="36" height="36" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_2_di" bpmnElement="Node_2">
				<dc:Bounds x="180" y="50" width="100" height="80" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_3_di" bpmnElement="Node_3">
				<dc:Bounds x="310" y="50" width="100" height="80" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_4_di" bpmnElement="Node_4">
				<dc:Bounds x="440" y="50" width="100" height="80" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_5_di" bpmnElement="Node_5">
				<dc:Bounds x="570" y="50" width="100" height="80" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_6_di" bpmnElement="Node_6">
				<dc:Bounds x="700" y="50" width="100" height="80" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_7_di" bpmnElement="Node_7">
				<dc:Bounds x="855" y="65" width="50" height="50" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Node_8_di" bpmnElement="Node_8">
				<dc:Bounds x="960" y="72" width="36" height="36" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_1_2_di" bpmnElement="Flow_1_2">
				<di:waypoint x="150" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="160" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="160" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="180" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_2_3_di" bpmnElement="Flow_2_3">
				<di:waypoint x="280" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="290" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="290" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="310" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_3_4_di" bpmnElement="Flow_3_4">
				<di:waypoint x="410" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="420" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="420" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="440" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_4_5_di" bpmnElement="Flow_4_5">
				<di:waypoint x="540" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="550" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="550" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="570" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_5_6_di" bpmnElement="Flow_5_6">
				<di:waypoint x="670" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="680" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="680" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="700" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_6_7_di" bpmnElement="Flow_6_7">
				<di:waypoint x="800" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="810" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="810" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="855" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_7_8_di" bpmnElement="Flow_7_8">
				<di:waypoint x="905" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="915" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="915" y="90" />
				<di:waypoint x="960" y="90" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNEdge id="Flow_7_2_di" bpmnElement="Flow_7_2">
				<di:waypoint x="880" y="115" />
				<di:waypoint x="880" y="135" />
				<di:waypoint x="230" y="135" />
				<di:waypoint x="230" y="130" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNEdge>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Lane_1_di" bpmnElement="Lane_1">
				<dc:Bounds x="80" y="10" width="1010" height="160" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
			<bpmndi:BPMNShape id="Global_Actor_di" bpmnElement="Global_Actor">
				<dc:Bounds x="50" y="10" width="1040" height="160" />
			</bpmndi:BPMNShape>
		</bpmndi:BPMNPlane>
	</bpmndi:BPMNDiagram>
</bpmn:definitions>

request.description:
Use this endpoint to remove the workflow.

The workflow can only be removed if no process have been created for this workflow.

item.description:
Routes for managing workflows.
Create/Update, List/Read, Delete blueprints

request.description: This workflow list _ALL_ processes created.

This endpoints returns all allowed and completed activities for the user provided.

This endpoint allows filtering by workflow id (send by query params)
This endpoints returns all allowed and completed activities for the user provided.
This endpoint returns the current state of a process.
This endpoints lists all states from a process ordered by descending step number.

This endpoint returns all allowed started activities for the provided process id.

It can return more than one activity if the process uses notify activities.

The **id** returned represents the activity manager id.

**Reminder**: If the user provided cannot access any activity, the endpoint will return a 404 response code.
This endpoint returns the data from a specific activity.

This endpoint is used to run a process currently at *unstarted*, *waiting* or *pending* status. 

If used after process creation, that is when the startNode inputSchema is evaluated.
Esse endpoint permite abortar um processo em execução.

This endpoint saves the payload of the current activity of a process.

This endpoint is not suited for blueprints that uses notify activity_managers. 

**Important**: This endpoint dos not affect the process current status.

This endpoint pushes the content from an activity to the process. 

Because it uses the process id, this endpoint is not suited for blueprints that uses notify activity managers.

The endpoint pushes all activities previously saved at the current activity manager.

**Important**: the endpoint does not save any payload. Save the content before pushing it to the process.

After pushing, the process leaves the *waiting* status and goes to *running* status

This endpoint saves the payload of the current activity of a process.

This endpoint is not suited for blueprints that uses notify activity_managers. 

**Important**: This endpoint dos not affect the process current status.

This endpoint joins the _Commit_ and _Push_ of an activity.

**Important**: It uses de *activity_manager_id*

Instead of using the process id, it uses the activity manager id so if can be used on any kind of activity.

item.name: States

request.description: Fetch the process state thru its id.

Fetch the process state thru the process id plus node id or step number.

One of the parameters needs to be provided.

If both are sent, step number will take precedent, even if no state is found to the value provided.

Please remind that if the search is done by node id, it could result in more than one state.

item.description:
Routes to fetch an specific state.

The route will return the same data from the process routes, but will add the parameters and the environment properties.
